summary: Applies a specific imagespace modifier depending on the game-hour. Allows for brighter days and darker nights.
descriptionHtml:
The mod consists of a script and 24 imagespace modifiers. Every ten-ingame minutes a check is made on the current game-time. This leads to brighter days with 12:00-4:00PM being the brightest; as well as darker nights with 0:00-4:00AM being the darkest.

The performance impact is negligible. If there is any fps loss, you're computer wasn't able to play Skyrim sufficiently to begin with (e.g, Pentium II).

I'd post pictures, but the difference will be different for everyone, due to various mods and injectors that modify the look of Skyrim. It's best for you to give this a shot yourself and judge whether or not you like the change.

You may not notice the effect immediately. Wait for ten ingame minutes (Actual waiting; don't call up that blasted menu), and the appropriate changes will be made.

There are no conflicts with this mod. So put it wherever in your load order.
author: FiftyTifty
